text: I want to thank the Alzheimer’s Association @ALZIMPACT for coming by my office this week to share information and discuss how we can do more to address this terrible disease. #ENDALZ
Had a wonderful time this morning at the Watsonville Legislative Breakfast. This was a great opportunity to see the great work being done in Watsonville.

Had a great discussion with Supervisors Anthony Botelho and Peter Hernandez along with County Administrative Officer Ray Espinosa from San Benito County on issues surrounding housing, transportation, and rural connectivity.

As a member of the Assembly Agriculture and Local Government Committees, it is an honor to represent #AD30 on issues and legislation brought before us Today's hearings included discussions on agricultural boards, planning matters, and multi-family housing.
Happy to have @jcmendezvargas on the team!
Yesterday, the Assembly and Senate Governmental Organization Committees convened a joint informational meeting on regulated sports betting in America.

We are facing a housing crisis in California. We must make it easier for Californians to own a home and live near their jobs. It was an honor to join @Scott_Wiener in Oakland this morning, to renew our commitment to making home ownership a reality for all Californians!

#Housing #Developers interested in purchasing or leasing surplus land for #AffordableHousing development should notify @California_HCD of their interest by completing HCD's Developer Interest - Local Agency Surplus Land survey

These Joe Serna Jr., Farmworker Housing Grants can be used in conjunction with my AB 1783 streamlined farmworker housing program. Let’s get them built! Attend the workshops & tell others. https://www.hcd.ca.gov/grants-funding/active-funding/fwhg.shtml #funding Thanks @CAgovernor @California_HCD

Thanks to @California_HCD, the release of $74 million is available for the Joe Serna Jr., Farmworker Housing Grant Program Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA). https://www.hcd.ca.gov/grants-funding/active-funding/fwhg.shtml #funding
Congratulations @RangelandTrust! Also pleased to see Monterey and San Benito projects funded thanks to the applications by Ag Land Trust and San Benito Agricultural Land Trust (SBALT)

The deadline to apply for Covered California and have coverage starting January 1, 2020 has been extended to Friday, December 20. To get more information, visit http://CoveredCa.com or call our office at 831-759-8676.
For more information, click on the link below or contact our office at 831-759-8676.

An important deadline for Covered California is coming up. If you are interested in getting health coverage though Covered California, sign up by December 15th to have coverage starting January 1st. Open enrollment will continue until January 31st, 2020.

Honored to attend the #COP25 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Madrid, Spain. Many climate change experts and scientists presented the alarming facts regarding the need for immediate #ClimateAction. See UN Climate Report: https://tinyurl.com/tcdexjv

I enjoyed a visit this week with Nayeli Lemus and her 4th grade classmates at the Charter School of Morgan Hill. On Thursday, Nayeli and her family joined @GavinNewsom & @JenSiebelNewsom to help light the Capitol Christmas Tree!

It was an honor to join Rafael Garcia and his family in Hollister to administer his oath to practice law in California. A San Benito native, Rafael recently passed the rigorous CA Bar Exam. Congratulations Rafael!

King City DMV will be open this Saturday to assist residents needing to get their Real ID. As of October 2020, you will need a Real ID: To board a domestic flight To enter a secure facility such as a military base To enter a Federal courthouse or other Federal office

This week, we celebrate the successes of the Healthy Soils Program thanks to the collaboration of state agencies, departments, farmers and ranchers! #HSW2019 #HealthySoilsWeek2019 http://www.cdfa.ca.gov/healthysoilsweek/
This week is #HealthySoilsWeek! In 2017, @CDFAnews launched the Healthy Soils Program to promote the development of healthy soils on California’s farmlands and ranch lands.
December is National Impaired Driving Prevention Month. This holiday season and throughout the year, be smart, don’t drive under the influence. Get home safe.
Thank you to California’s Farmers and Farmworkers for feeding our families at Thanksgiving and throughout the year! Have a happy and safe Thanksgiving!
If you are traveling on the roads this holiday, please make sure to check the weather and road conditions before heading out. Have a safe and happy Thanksgiving!

Enjoyed the wonderful performances at the 25th annual celebration of Diwali by the Indian Association of South Santa Clara County. Thank you to all of the event organizers that made the night possible.
Enjoyed sitting down with Mayor LeBarre to discuss the progress being made in King City. #AD30
On this Transgender Day of Remembrance, we remember all those lost to anti-transgender violence. This hate and bigotry has no place in our society, we are all equal.

This week our office had the wonderful opportunity to participate in Operation Gobble. With the support of Cal Water, turkey vouchers are distributed to local community groups that will be able to help families this holiday season.

Had the opportunity to join the Santa Clara County Complete Count Committee in Gilroy. It is crucial that we educate local residents about the importance of the Census and that we do everything we can to count all people in our communities!
APPLY NOW: #Prop68 Groundwater Treatment and Remediation Grant Program UPDATE @CaWaterBoards -- $74 million to treat/prevent/reduce contamination of groundwater https://bit.ly/2ptdhbe
Immigrants are the fabric of America. #HomeIsHere

Today the SCOTUS heard oral arguments on the Trumps Administration to end DACA. These recipients pay taxes, are educated and contribute to the U.S. economy. To the 220,000 DACA recipients in the State of California I stand with you and value your resilience.

It was an honor to join the community at the San Benito LULAC Veterans Day breakfast this morning. Thank you to all those who have served and your families. Your sacrifices make our freedom possible. #veteransday2019

Thank you to our #Veterans, we honor you this #VeteransDay and are grateful for your service! Find info on how @MyCalVet can assist veterans, visit http://www.CalVet.ca.gov. Housing and Homelessness Prevention Program now offering $75 mil https://bit.ly/36QKxtV for housing.
Thanks to local donations, the Veterans Day Parade Committee, and @SupervisorAlejo a sign memorializing each soldier will be going up on local highways. #VeteransDay
It was a privilege to join community members, elected officials, and veterans in honoring 5 brave local soldiers who made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.
This trailer offered parents the opportunity to learn more about how to spot signs of substance abuse in young people and how those substances such as opioids could be hidden in their rooms.

Grateful for the opportunity to host the RALI Cares Code 3 education trailer at last week’s San Benito High School football game. https://www.kion546.com/news/hollister-parents-learn-about-the-secrets-of-teen-drug-use/1138275985

Congratulations to all those recognized by the Monterey County Hospitality Association today! Each one of the awardees was recognized for going above and beyond in working to make welcome the thousands of visitors the Monterey Bay receives every day.
The Hollister DMV office will be closed November 7 at 5 p.m. and reopen November 13 at 9 a.m. You can visit nearby offices in Gilroy, Salinas, or Watsonville if you have a DMV related issue.
It was a privilege to be at Fort Hunter Liggett this afternoon to attend the ribbon cutting of The Army School System training facility.
Great to see the big turnout for our senior scam stoppers seminar in Gilroy. Thank you to all the agencies for providing information to seniors and the Gilroy Senior Center for hosting us.

Immigrants make a difference in our community every day. I am proud to join with colleagues from the @LatinoCaucus in continuing the hard work to make sure all Californians are treated with the respect and dignity they deserve. #ThankYouPeteWilson
I hope everyone has a happy and safe Halloween today!

#PSPS Resiliency RFP Now Available -- Governor's Administration Launches $75 Million Program for State and Local Governments to Respond to Impacts of Utility-Initiated Power Shutoffs via @CaCities https://shar.es/a31dH0

Today I would like to recognize and thank all of our first responders. Their sacrifices and efforts do not go unnoticed, especially today as we face an array of emergencies that require swift and fearless action. #NationalFirstRespondersDay #ThankAFirstResponderhttps

Thank you @CAgovernor and @californiapuc for taking action to ensure that utilities are using Public Safety Power Shut-offs (PSPS) appropriately and as a tool of last resort to ensure public safety. https://bit.ly/2PqNT0j
Thank You #Baler Team and @TEACH_SBHS for hosting #CALeg #CTE Lunch & Learn - Proud of my roots #Vimeo https://vimeo.com/368589689 @AsmPatODonnel @Ash_Kalra
@GavinNewsom signed our bill, AB 936 - groundbreaking leg. to protect our health and environment from a non-floating oil spill! @NRDC @SFBaykeeper
Over 50 yrs ago, Dolores Huerta lobbied to end the Bracero program. Today, she’s asking @GavinNewsom to sign AB 1783 for a better future for our farmworkers.

Lt. Governor @EleniForCA has joined @SenKamalaHarris Fmr. HUD Sec. @JulianCastro and many more in support of the Farmworker Housing Act of 2019 – AB 1783. The bill is currently at the desk of @GavinNewsom
Another strong piece in support of AB 1783 to help farmworker families! @GavinNewsom

Had a great discussion on the importance of water today before celebrating the opening of the @purewatermry facility. This project will provide our region with a safe, clean sustainable source of water that benefits local residents and our vital agricultural industry.

It was wonderful to join local community leaders and elected officials such as Seaside Mayor Ian Oglesby at the United Way of Monterey County’s 21st annual community breakfast to hear about the incredible work the United Way does in our community. #montereycounty
A special thanks to @CRgarlic, @AnaerobeSystems, and Benito Valley Farms in partnership with @calclimateag and @ucanr for co-hosting the tour. @CDFAnews
Thank you to @BauerKahan, @AsmMarkStone, @AD26Mathis, @AlexPadilla4CA and everyone who attended the #AD30 Ag Tour last week. Our day was educational and motivating to say the least!

Today is National Voter Registration Day! If you have not registered yet, please remember that a vote is your voice in our democracy. Don’t forget to re-register if you have moved since the last time you have voted and if you are 16-17-years old, you can now pre-register to vote.

It was great to catch up with community leaders at the Graduation Ceremony & Dinner celebrating the Leadership Morgan Hill Class of 2019. Graduates spent nine months learning in-depth knowledge of local political, economic, and government structures in Morgan Hill.
She did a wonderful job interning in our office this summer, and working with our Youth and Government Leadership Program.
It is wonderful to see Fabiola be recognized for the selfless work she has done in our community. Her dedication and commitment to serving others demonstrates what an amazing leader she has become.
Important step to keep our families and communities safe!

Excited that AB 936 was just passed by the California Senate! This bill will help improve how California prepares for a potential non-floating oil spill and equips responders with better tools to clean up a non-floating oil spill. Thank you to the sponsors @NRDC and @SFBaykeeper
Women regularly make history, but too often are ignored in the record. @officialNWHP aims to change that. #WomensEqualityDay celebrates women winning the right to vote.

Congratulations to Pajaro Valley Pride on their 4th annual event. It was another wonderful year with community coming together to celebrate and a chance for many to learn about important resources available to residents.
AD 30 is a large district, but it is special to have the opportunity to travel throughout our region each week.
Call the toll-free number (844) 613-5152 or go to https://sites.google.com/view/ccgroundwater to schedule your free well test.

A free testing program for Central Coast residents who get their drinking water from domestic wells expands to San Benito County next week. I encourage San Benito residents to take advantage of this free opportunity to test your wells and ensure your drinking water is safe.

It was great to meet and hear from members of the Monterey County Area Agency on Aging Advisory Council today. It was wonderful to have a discussion on how we can do more to support our senior population in our community and throughout California.
It was an honor to join with members of the California Latino Legislative Caucus to present $5,000 scholarship awards to amazing students from our district and across California.
There is a heat advisory covering much of our region. Please be mindful of these helpful actions you can take to stay safe in this excessive heat.
Students will not only be able to enroll in their classes for free, but also get leadership training, mentorship, and school materials to be successful in their studies.
Hartnell Students return to classes this week and it is wonderful that hundreds of first-year, full-time students will benefit from the Salinas Valley Promise.

We are making real progress as a state to reduce our greenhouse gas emissions while our economy continues to grow. California must continue to be a worldwide leader in smart climate policies that result in a healthier planet. http://cert1.mail-west.com/mc7rm7Jyj7W/yg617Jgtmyuzjan/u34m9/qvnq7Jf4dqwr/58tyg617J/837wyupjgaz?_c=d%7Cze7pzanwmhlzgt%7C16tlg85wchlj738&_ce=1565657408.66660807204cfa81bfdd6f53c8b398b3

I want to also thank and recognize the panel members from @MBEPartnership, the County of Monterey, Center for Community Advocacy, CHISPA and @MontereyCFB for participating in the substantive dialogue.
We had a great turnout of community members last night at the Housing Town Hall in Greenfield. Thank you to Supervisor Chris Lopez for helping host the event.

Happy National Health Center Week. I would like to recognize @foothillhealth and all of the Community Health Centers throughout California who do so much for our communities. Visit https://healthcenterweek.org/about-nhcw/ for more information! #NHCW2019 #Health4all
Our country was in need, and they answered the call. Today we celebrate #PurpleHeartDay to honor the recipients of the Purple Heart. Thank you for your sacrifice and service.
The #MillFire is now 70% contained thanks to the amazing job our firefighters have done this past week. More information below.
Amazing work by the US Forestry Service and CalFire who are working tirelessly to put out the #MillFire in #AD30. Grateful for the work of our firefighters!
Important information on how you can retrieve personal items left at the Garlic Festival. Thank you for being patient as the investigations continues.
Latest update on the #MillFire in #AD30 from the US Forestry Service.
Update from the brave first responders at the Gilroy PD. The situation is still unfolding, more information coming.
With the Legislature in recess, it has been wonderful to travel throughout #AD30 to meet and hear from residents about issues and concerns in our community.#CaLeg

Tomorrow, July 24th, the DMV will be closed in the morning to reinforce customer service training and to better prepare employees to process REAL ID applications. The DMV offices will re-open at 1:00 p.m.
It was great to be home in Hollister and share what our local, satellite offices and staff are able to do to serve residents.

AB 1783, the Farmworker Housing Act, has passed the Senate Governance and Finance Committee with a 5-2 vote! This is another important step forward towards creating a tool to help build dignified housing for our farmworkers and their families.

(3/3) keep us fed and help drive our agricultural communities and state economy. I thank the members of the committee and sponsors of the bill for their support and implore more Senators to step up to make this opportunity a reality for our farmworker families.

(2/3) friendly housing for farmworkers in California. We are facing a humanitarian crisis, and I believe we have a moral responsibility to act. AB 1783 helps make it easier for farmers and non-profit organizations to build dignified, family-friendly housing for the workers who

(1/3) Today, the California State Senate Housing Committee passed The Farmworker Housing Act of 2019 (AB 1783). The bill passed with a vote of 7-3 and is heading to Senate Governance and Finance Committee. This legislation creates a streamlined process to build dignified, family-

July is California State Parks Month! I encourage you to get outdoors and enjoy our local parks. Open spaces are crucial for a community’s health and here in Assembly District 30, we have some of the most beautiful and vibrant #CAStateParks! http://bit.ly/2tOGHOg @CAStateParks

Thank you! @CAgovernor for funding the Golden State Teacher Grant Program, and adding my thanks to @LDH_ed AB 1623 joint author @AsmPatODonnell and our AB 1623 co-sponsors @EdTrustWest and @publicadvocates.

Kicked off our 2019 Youth and Government Leadership Program today! It’s wonderful to see students excited and engaged on how they can learn more about our State Legislature and how they can make a difference in their community.

Our Soledad satellite office is open every Tuesday to assist Salinas Valley constituents. Our office can assist with DMV, Medi-Cal/Covered California, unemployment/disability insurance, veterans’ benefits, state taxes, and other state related issues.

Great teachers change lives, but we do far too little to support them. As a result, our state is dealing with a severe teacher shortage. That's why I authored AB 1623 to create the Golden State Teacher Grant Program.

Our housing crisis has hit our region hard – especially our farmworkers. That is why I introduced AB 1783. This bill makes it easier for farmers and nonprofit organizations to build dignified, family-friendly housing for farmworkers.

I am proud to have cast my vote to approve an on-time and balanced budget that makes historic investments in our schools, housing, and healthcare. A summary of the 2019-2020 #CABudget can be found here: https://abgt.assembly.ca.gov/sites/abgt.assembly.ca.gov/files/Floor%20Report%20of%20the%202019-20%20Budget.pdf

I am proud to name @Puentes_SC as the AD 30 Nonprofit of the Year. Community Bridges provides critical services and programs to help meet the needs of the diverse population in our region. They play an irreplaceable role in our communities.

It was an honor to sit down with my friend @DoloresHuerta and talk about AB 1783 and the need to build more quality housing for our farmworkers. You can listen to our conversation in the latest episode of the #LookWest Podcast: https://asmdc.org/look-west

I am proud to announce AB 1783 passed the Assembly Floor today with bipartisan support. The bill creates a new streamlined process for farmers to build farmworker housing on agricultural land, with safeguards to protect people and the environment.
